text: @charlie_deacon @Srsivanesan @RBKingston @seethingabout @renton_phil @EnvAgencySE You can ask 4 update against your NIRS number via their website. Find out what category it was out in. If you are concerned about biodiversity issues  then you have to make that a separate complaint which is a pain but that is the only way it gets through

@charlie_deacon @alison_fure @RBKingston @seethingabout @renton_phil @EnvAgencySE Water pollution is often evidenced by the changes to invertebrate populations, given that @EnvAgency have supports reports of polluted waters based on RMI surveys etc. Maybe they would be willing to investigate water pollution impacts on this site using Biodiversity indicatorsü§û

@YorkList @misscharlesyork The #York Millennium Bridge/Skeltergate Bridge loop taking in Terry Avenue and New Walk is a lovely, easy tree-lined route with river views. It's not usually muddy (unless the river recently flooded). But do it quick as the @EnvAgencyYNE will be closing Terry Avenue soon!

urls.title: Transforming the Trent Valley
urls.description: The Washlands is an extensive piece of natural land that follows the river through to the heart of Burton upon Trent. The vision, informed by consultation with key stakeholders and the local community, addresses how to best balance the regular flooding of the area with the need for public access and recreation, whilst promoting nature conservation and a more environmentally sustainable approach to green space management. Through our natural heritage project, known as Living Floodplains, we will help to

@JamesAbbott2013 @michaelst1001 @EnvAgency It may well be - but it might be  better outcome than international shipping - especially if we were to be clever and recycle heat as the Scandinavian nations do

@severnrivers @DaveThroupEA @AfonyddCymru @theriverstrust @TheRiverSevern @EnvAgencyMids @NatResWales @ChrisBaingerEA @SevernUnlocked @NaturalEngland @AnglingTrust I‚Äôd love too but we need to concentrate on rising river levels and especially on the Severn we need to create fry river beds to cope with flooding and why not redesign the weirs to lower when heavy rain is on the way

@ecoevoenviro @michaelst1001 @EnvAgency Agree its a calculation that needs to be made. However what we do know is that operating at capacity the Rivenhall incinerator would need 600 ktpa to keep it fed and would rely on importing waste into Essex - every tonne by road. Thats a big loading on that side of the equation.
